results.title: The Last valley
results.creator_credit: James Clavell, Season Productions and ABC Pictures (US)
results.brief_description: Set in 17th century Austria during the Thirty Years’ War, “The Last valley” adapted from J.B. Pick’s novel was written, directed and produced by noted novelist and occasional film director, James Clavell (Shogun, The Great escape). This is a story of war and peace, of soldiers and villagers and a beautiful hidden valley which lies protected from the ravages of war going on around it. Vogel (Omar Sharif), once a school teacher but now on the run, has the fortune to stumble across the peaceful village where he is given lodgings in return for protection. The peace and calm soon erupts into conflict and violence however, when an exhausted army of soldiers led by “The Captain” (Michael Caine) also discover the hidden valley. A truce with the village community and “The Captain” is arranged through the mediation of Vogel, pledging to protect the people of the valley from invasion in return for food and shelter over the cold winter months. Filmed in Todd A-O and on location in Trins in Tirol, Austria. Cast also includes Florinda Bolkan, Nigel Davenport, Per Oscarsson.

results.title: Shock to the system
results.creator_credit: Jan Egleson, Patrick McCormick and Corsair Pictures
results.brief_description: Graham Marshall (Michael Caine) is a middle-aged New York advertising exec recently passed over in a sure fire promotion to a younger subordinate (Peter Riegert). Suffering the effects of this crushing oversight, Graham inadvertently pushes a panhandler into the oncoming path of a subway train, killing the man instantly. Charged with murder, Graham is released on manslaughter. This leads him to speculate on the possibility of repeating his actions - murder, camouflaged as accident - and plots to get back at some of his enemies, starting at home with his shrewish wife (Swoosie Kurtz). The downtrodden suit has turned into a likeable avenger. This parable of corporate greed in post 1980s Wall Street is a curious mix of thriller and black comedy. Cast also includes Will Patton as the obligatory gumshoe and Elizabeth McGovern as the sympathetic co-worker and love interest. Based on the novel by Simon Brett.

results.title: Without a clue
results.creator_credit: Thom Eberhardt, Mark Stirdivant and ITC Group
results.brief_description: What if the most famous detective of all time - Sherlock Holmes (Michael Caine) - was a drunk, gambling, womanizing, one time actor, created in the mind of his previously overshadowed but vastly superior assistant, Doctor Watson (Ben Kingsley)? Such is the premise of “Without a clue”. Fed up with Holmes’ bad form, Watson attempts to branch out on his own as the ‘Crime Doctor’, only to be told that it’s Holmes the people want. Thus, Holmes and Watson are forced to join sides again on a case involving counterfeit 5 pound notes. All is progressing well until the appearance of Holmes/Watson’s nemesis, Professor Moriaty, then Watson disappears into the canal - presumed dead, and it’s up to the oft inebriated Holmes to solve his first case, unassisted, and prove his crime solving capacity to the dubious Inspector Lestrade. Cast also includes Lysette Anthony, Jeffrey Jones and Paul Freeman.

results.title: Landscape after battle
results.creator_credit: Andrzej Wajda and Polish Corporation for Film Production
results.brief_description: World War 2 has ended, but former prisoners of the Nazis are left with emotional scars. Life outside the camp is now unknown and unimaginable. A small group of survivors wait for their futures to be decided in an old army barracks. Two members of the group begin an affair, until the woman is accidentally killed by an American guard. Based on the stories of Tadeusz Borowski, an Auschwitz survivor. An examination of life after witnessing and living through the holocaust. Nominated for the Palme d’Or award at the Cannes Film Festival in 1970. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Ligong Xu, Bill Kong, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, China Films Co-Production, Zoom Hunt International, EDKO Film, Good Machine International, Columbia Pictures and Sony Pictures
results.brief_description: An epic love story and action drama set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai and Yu Shu Lien are duty bound warriors whose unspoken love spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu and Lo represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ang Lee, Ligong Xu, Bill Kong, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, China Films Co-Production, Zoom Hunt International, EDKO Film, Good Machine International, Columbia Pictures and Sony Pictures
results.description: An epic love story and action drama, set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai (Chow Yun Fat) and Yu Shu Lien (Michelle Yeoh) are cast as duty bound warriors whose unspoken love for each other spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu (a promising young warrior) and Lo (her bandit lover) represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love. After Li surrenders his legendary sword to Yu and vows to stop fighting, his plans to retire are halted when the sword is stolen. In their quest to recover it, Li and Yu confront the evil forces headed by Jade Fox who is attempting to recruit the impressionable young Jen Yu to her cause. As the opposing forces of good and evil battle to secure the sword, they also struggle to lure Jen Lu to their side. Based on an early 20th century novel by Wang Du Lu, the project was scripted by Wang Hui Ling, James Schamus and Tsai Kuo Jung. Photographed by Peter Pau. Martial arts choreography by Yuen Wo-Ping. (Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)

results.title: The Omen
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Harvey Bernhard and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In a moment of grief American Diplomat Robert Thorn (Gregory Peck) swaps his stillborn son with a newly born orphan, unbeknownst to his wife, Katherine (Lee Remick). What they both don’t know however is that the child was born at 6am, on the 6th day, of the 6th month (666), fulfilling a prophecy in the Bible that the coming of Armageddon will begin with the birth of Satan’s son. As their son, Damien (Harvey Stephens), grows older, it becomes apparent that this is no ordinary child. Sure enough, evil nannies, vicious dobermans and tormented priests begin to plague the family, while mysterious and gruesome deaths occur around the boy. This popular film spawned two sequels (“Damien: Omen 2” and “The Final conflict”). This 25th anniversary edition contains a documentary on the making of the film called “666: The Omen revealed”, a feature called “Curse or coincidence” about the mysterious incidents surrounding its production, interview clips and the original theatrical trailer. Cast also includes David Warner, Billie Whitelaw and Holly Palance.

results.title: Where eagles dare
results.creator_credit: Brian G. Hutton, Elliott Kastner and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Richard Burton and Clint Eastwood star as Allied agents on a daring suicide mission in this tense wartime adventure. Held captive in an almost impregnable fortress in Bavaria, American General Carnaby is at the mercy of the German High Command. A group of agents attempt to liberate the General but as the mission progresses it becomes apparent that a double agent is attempting to foil this daring plot. Cast also includes Mary Ure, Micxhael Hordern, Patrick Wymark, Donald Houston. Based on the novel by Alistair MacLean.

results.title: The Right stuff
results.creator_credit: Philip Kaufman, Robert Chartoff, Irwin Winkler, Warner Bros Pictures and The Ladd Company
results.brief_description: Based on Tom Wolfe’s best seller, “The Right Stuff” recounts the development of the American Space programme. Spanning 15 years, the film begins with Chuck Yeager breaking the sound barrier and moves on to concentrate primarily on the original seven Mercury astronauts. The film relates the perils and frustrations of the astronauts, their arduous training and complex personal lives, and the absurd lengths to which they must go to satisfy the public’s demand for real heroes. Cast includes Sam Shepard, Scott Glenn, Ed Harris, Dennis Quaid, Fred Ward and Barbara Hershey.

results.title: For whom the bell tolls
results.brief_description: A romantic drama set in 1937, during the Spanish Civil War. Gary Cooper plays Robert Jordan, an American who has joined a guerilla group and has been assigned to blow-up a Falangist controlled Bridge. He meets and falls in love with a young woman, played by Ingrid Bergman, who joined the group after her brutal treatment at the hands of the enemy. Written by Dudley Nichols, based on the novel by Ernest Hemingway, which was unanimously voted the best novel of the year in 1941 by the Pulitzer Prize committee, but was vetoed for political reasons. Cast also includes Akim Tamiroff, Arturo de Cordova and Katina Paxinou. Music by Victor Young. Photography by Ray Rennahan. Edited by Sherman Todd and John F. Link. (Awards: Katina Paxinou, Oscar 1943, Best Supporting Actress)

results.title: Celebrity
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Jean Doumanian, Magnolia Productions and Sweetland Films BV
results.brief_description: Kenneth Branagh is Lee Simon, a media obsessed journalist who is obsessed with celebrities and whose one aim in life is to bed as many famous media people as he can. This surprisingly light hearted satire by famous misanthrope, Woody Allen, sends up the lavish decadence of the famous and our perennial fascination with their sex lives and bad habits. Many Hollywood stars play themselves or versions of themselves, including a hilarious cameo by Leonardo Di Caprio as a self-obsessed drug addled superstar. Judy Davis plays Lee’s long suffering wife, who can’t compete with the famous starlets who come Lee’s way, and Branagh himself is excellent in a role which sees him spookily take on Woody Allen’s persona and quirks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Woody Allen, Jean Doumanian, Magnolia Productions and Sweetland Films BV
